intro: Alyogyne pinoniana, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hakea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant produces small, urn-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Alyogyne pinoniana is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
